com.samysadi.acs.core.event

Interface Event

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Cloneable
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    DispensableEvent, FailuresFactory.FailureEvent, FailuresFactory.FailureRepairEvent, FailuresFactory.RepairEvent
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    DispensableEventChain, DispensableEventImpl, EventChain, EventImpl, NotifierImpl.NotifyEvent

    public interface Event
extends Cloneable
    Events are processed by the simulator after they are scheduled when the simulation time is equal to the event's scheduled time.

    If multiple events are scheduled at the same time, then they are processed in the order they were scheduled.

    Since:
    1.0
    See Also:
    EventChain

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void cancel()
      Cancels this event, and removes it from the simulator events queue.
      Event clone() 
      Long getScheduledAt()
      Returns the simulation time when this event will be processed or null if this event was not scheduled.
      boolean isScheduled()
      Returns true if this event was scheduled and put in the simulation's event queue.
      void process()
      This method is called by the simulator when the time has come to process this event.
      void scheduledAt(Long time)
      This method is called by the simulator after that this event is scheduled.

    • Method Detail

      • clone

        Event clone()

      • getScheduledAt

        Long getScheduledAt()
        Returns the simulation time when this event will be processed or null if this event was not scheduled.
        Returns:
        the simulation time when this event will be processed or null

      • isScheduled

        boolean isScheduled()
        Returns true if this event was scheduled and put in the simulation's event queue. false is returned if this event was not scheduled, or if it was canceled.
        Returns:
        true if this event was scheduled

      • scheduledAt

        void scheduledAt(Long time)
        This method is called by the simulator after that this event is scheduled.

        Note that you should not need to call this method, instead use Simulator.schedule(Event).

        Parameters:
        time - the scheduled simulation time when this event will be processed

      • cancel

        void cancel()
        Cancels this event, and removes it from the simulator events queue.

        This method is a helper which calls the simulator's Simulator.cancel(Event) on this event.

        Nothing happens if this event is not scheduled.

      • process

        void process()
        This method is called by the simulator when the time has come to process this event.
